speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: SCENE III. The same. The Forum.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Enter SICINIUS and BRUTUS

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: In this point charge him home, that he affects

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Tyrannical power: if he evade us there,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enforce him with his envy to the people,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: And that the spoil got on the Antiates

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Was ne'er distributed.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enter an AEdile

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: What, will he come?

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: He's coming.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: How accompanied?

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: With old Menenius, and those senators

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: That always favour'd him.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Have you a catalogue

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Of all the voices that we have procured

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Set down by the poll?

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: I have; 'tis ready.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Have you collected them by tribes?

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: I have.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Assemble presently the people hither;

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: And when they bear me say 'It shall be so

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: I' the right and strength o' the commons,' be it either

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: For death, for fine, or banishment, then let them

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: If I say fine, cry 'Fine;' if death, cry 'Death.'

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Insisting on the old prerogative

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: And power i' the truth o' the cause.

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: I shall inform them.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: And when such time they have begun to cry,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Let them not cease, but with a din confused

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enforce the present execution

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Of what we chance to sentence.

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: Very well.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Make them be strong and ready for this hint,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: When we shall hap to give 't them.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Go about it.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Exit AEdile

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Put him to choler straight: he hath been used

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Ever to conquer, and to have his worth

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Of contradiction: being once chafed, he cannot

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Be rein'd again to temperance; then he speaks

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: What's in his heart; and that is there which looks

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: With us to break his neck.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Well, here he comes.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Enter CORIOLANUS, MENENIUS, and COMINIUS, with Senators and Patricians

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Calmly, I do beseech you.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Ay, as an ostler, that for the poorest piece

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Will bear the knave by the volume. The honour'd gods

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Keep Rome in safety, and the chairs of justice

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Supplied with worthy men! plant love among 's!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Throng our large temples with the shows of peace,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: And not our streets with war!

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Amen, amen.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: A noble wish.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Re-enter AEdile, with Citizens

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Draw near, ye people.

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: List to your tribunes. Audience: peace, I say!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: First, hear me speak.

speaker: Both Tribunes
text_entry: Well, say. Peace, ho!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Shall I be charged no further than this present?

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Must all determine here?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: I do demand,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: If you submit you to the people's voices,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Allow their officers and are content

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: To suffer lawful censure for such faults

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: As shall be proved upon you?

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I am content.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Lo, citizens, he says he is content:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The warlike service he has done, consider; think

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Upon the wounds his body bears, which show

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Like graves i' the holy churchyard.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Scratches with briers,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Scars to move laughter only.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Consider further,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: That when he speaks not like a citizen,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You find him like a soldier: do not take

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: His rougher accents for malicious sounds,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: But, as I say, such as become a soldier,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Rather than envy you.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Well, well, no more.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: What is the matter

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: That being pass'd for consul with full voice,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I am so dishonour'd that the very hour

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: You take it off again?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Answer to us.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Say, then: 'tis true, I ought so.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: We charge you, that you have contrived to take

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: From Rome all season'd office and to wind

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Yourself into a power tyrannical;

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: For which you are a traitor to the people.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: How! traitor!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Nay, temperately; your promise.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: The fires i' the lowest hell fold-in the people!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Call me their traitor! Thou injurious tribune!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Within thine eyes sat twenty thousand deaths,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: In thy hand clutch'd as many millions, in

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Thy lying tongue both numbers, I would say

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: 'Thou liest' unto thee with a voice as free

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: As I do pray the gods.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Mark you this, people?

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: To the rock, to the rock with him!

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Peace!

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: We need not put new matter to his charge:

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: What you have seen him do and heard him speak,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Beating your officers, cursing yourselves,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Opposing laws with strokes and here defying

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Those whose great power must try him; even this,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: So criminal and in such capital kind,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Deserves the extremest death.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: But since he hath

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Served well for Rome,--

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: What do you prate of service?

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I talk of that, that know it.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: You?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Is this the promise that you made your mother?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Know, I pray you,--

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I know no further:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Let them pronounce the steep Tarpeian death,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Vagabond exile, raying, pent to linger

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: But with a grain a day, I would not buy

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Their mercy at the price of one fair word;

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Nor cheque my courage for what they can give,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To have't with saying 'Good morrow.'

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: For that he has,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: As much as in him lies, from time to time

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Envied against the people, seeking means

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: To pluck away their power, as now at last

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Given hostile strokes, and that not in the presence

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Of dreaded justice, but on the ministers

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: That do distribute it; in the name o' the people

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: And in the power of us the tribunes, we,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Even from this instant, banish him our city,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: In peril of precipitation

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: From off the rock Tarpeian never more

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: To enter our Rome gates: i' the people's name,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: I say it shall be so.

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: It shall be so, it shall be so; let him away:

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: He's banish'd, and it shall be so.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Hear me, my masters, and my common friends,--

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: He's sentenced; no more hearing.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Let me speak:

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I have been consul, and can show for Rome

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Her enemies' marks upon me. I do love

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: My country's good with a respect more tender,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: More holy and profound, than mine own life,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: My dear wife's estimate, her womb's increase,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And treasure of my loins; then if I would

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Speak that,--

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: We know your drift: speak what?

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: There's no more to be said, but he is banish'd,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: As enemy to the people and his country:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: It shall be so.

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: It shall be so, it shall be so.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: You common cry of curs! whose breath I hate

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: As reek o' the rotten fens, whose loves I prize

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: As the dead carcasses of unburied men

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: That do corrupt my air, I banish you;

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: And here remain with your uncertainty!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Let every feeble rumour shake your hearts!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Your enemies, with nodding of their plumes,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Fan you into despair! Have the power still

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To banish your defenders; till at length

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Your ignorance, which finds not till it feels,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Making not reservation of yourselves,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Still your own foes, deliver you as most

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Abated captives to some nation

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: That won you without blows! Despising,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: For you, the city, thus I turn my back:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: There is a world elsewhere.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Exeunt CORIOLANUS, COMINIUS, MENENIUS, Senators, and Patricians

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: The people's enemy is gone, is gone!

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: Our enemy is banish'd! he is gone! Hoo! hoo!

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: Shouting, and throwing up their caps

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Go, see him out at gates, and follow him,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: As he hath followed you, with all despite;

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Give him deserved vexation. Let a guard

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Attend us through the city.

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: Come, come; let's see him out at gates; come.

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: The gods preserve our noble tribunes! Come.

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: Exeunt
